noun.description: English regional (Yorkshire and west midlands) and Welsh English (southern). An idler, a loafer; a vagrant; a disreputable person. Chiefly derogatory.
Canadian (originally and chiefly Newfoundland). A small fishing boat, typically round-bottomed with a square stern; a small punt. Now chiefly historical.

adjective.description: (attributive). English regional (chiefly west midlands and Gloucs.). Rough, disreputable; idle. Chiefly derogatory. Now rare.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Hunt's Merchants' Magazine. From the name of George Bridges Rodney, 1st Baron Rodney, British admiral.
